title: [Large-scale] Social Issue-Solving Projects Utilizing Computer-Supported Collaborative Learning (CSCL)

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental digital competence and general understanding of social issues
context.additional_context: Learners access 15-20 minute microlearning content daily via smartphones and perform collaborative tasks weekly. Discussion and project-based learning centered on regional/social issues are emphasized

learning_goals: Learners can explain effective group role-allocation strategies in a CSCL (Computer-Supported Collaborative Learning) environment with over 80% accuracy.
Learners can proactively participate in collaborative learning activities at least twice weekly using mobile devices.
Learners apply team collaboration skills (communication, conflict management) at least three times in cooperative projects addressing social issues.
Learners understand IMS-LD (Learning Design)-based instructional design principles and apply them to their learning pathways with over 70% proficiency.

resources: CLFP (Collaborative Learning Flow Patterns)-based group management tool
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
